Our Team

Observable Compute Foundation is led by researchers, legal experts, and community advocates committed to accurate technology terminology.

Leadership

Adam Ian Stratmeyer, J.D.

President & Principal Researcher

Adam holds a J.D. with regulatory compliance concentration from University of South Dakota and completed Masters-level coursework in Human Factors Psychology. Previously taught psychology, sociology, and speech at Western Dakota Technical College and worked in IRB compliance at USD. Author of the Observable Function trilogy and creator of IRB GPT.

Julia R. Huntsberger

Secretary & External Relations

Julia manages partnerships, grant applications, and external communications. Background in trust analysis and institutional coordination.

Travis D. Shinabarger

Treasurer & Operations

Travis handles administrative operations, record-keeping, and financial management.

Board of Directors

Observable Compute Foundation is governed by a three-member Board of Directors. Advisory Board (2+ members) to be recruited Q2 2026.

Join Us

We're actively recruiting:

  • Advisory Board members — rural community leader, ethics academic
  • Part-time Research Engineer — automation, NLP, data pipelines (pending grant funding)
  • Volunteer contributors — data entry, source curation, fact-checking

Contact Us to Get Involved

Observable Compute Foundation

A 501(c)(3) nonprofit research institute mapping technology terminology evolution and legal-technical alignment.
